Derek James wrote:

>I've been looking at JRobots as a possible environment
>(rather than coding everything from scratch):
>
>http://www.cfxweb.net/~jrobots/
>
>  
>
Hi Derek,  Strangely enough I had a brief  look into JRobots last week 
with the intention of generating a bot using NEAT. The one headache I 
can forsee is that the java code you submit cannot use any of the java 
framework classes! So basically I think I would be looking at making a 
port of Ken's neural network code into an minimal implementaion that is 
written in raw Java. Which at first sounds easy but then think about the 
lack of the Math functions! I don't know, maybe there IS a basic library 
of essentials that I didn't pick up on.

Anyway your quest for an environment brings me back to one of my 
original points which is - wouldnlt it be nice to have a central 
repository of environment code. Prefereably modified to expose a 
standard interface (or one of a set of interfaces) that we define for 
use in EANN/GA type projects.

Colin.
